page.title: 20CUSTOMS OF ALLENDALE
page.content: Each New Year's Eve,strangely dressed figures,{the Guizers,}parade through the streets of Allendale with barrels of blazing tar on their heads. Converging on the {Market Place,}the{ {Guizers}throw the flaming barrels on to a bonfire.Dancing and merrymaking continue into the early hours. Once the chimes of midnight have struck {first footing }begins.A dark haired man must be the first person to enter your home.He carries gifts of bread and coal,to bring you luck. Besides the ceremony of Tar Barrels, the other great occasion in the town used to be the annual{hirings,}held on the Friday before 13th May and Friday after 29th October,when local men were hired to work on farms. {Kern Superrs or Corn suppers}were given by farmers after the harvest. After supper,dancing lasted till dawn.
